ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Correct the time-dependent tilt of LETG/HRC-S spectra by adjusting TG_D.

DESC.PARA:
&cltool; reads in an LETG/HRC-S evt2 file (usually this will be the output of the dewiggle tool) and adjusts the TG_D values of all events by applying a linear correction as a function of TG_MLAM. The tilt is in units of deg/Ang and can be estimated from Fig. 5 ("Time dependent tilts in deg/Ã…") at
Cross-Dispersion Wiggles.
Only TG_D values are affected; the output file will not exhibit any changes if displayed in sky or detector coordinates.

&cltool; is generally used in combination with the dewiggle and symmetrize commands--also contributed software tools--to prepare LETG/HRC-S spectra so that narrower spectral extraction regions can be used to improve the S/N of low-S/N data.
Input FITS file event list with columns TG_D and TG_MLAM.
Output FITS file event list with modified TG_D column.
The residual dispersion angle, in units of deg/Ang.
Controls the amount of information tool prints to the screen.
